name: treatment of stalk, in wood heater 6kW | heat, central or small-scale, other than natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20300/documentation

This dataset is an estimation of the treatment of average stalk (from kenaf and jute) in a wood heater of 6KW capacity. The emissions have been calculated based on standard emission factors of hardwood combustion in this type of furnace. Stalk has average dry mass content of 89% and a lower calorific value of 13.8 MJl/kg fresh mass.

From reception of stalk at wood heater

This activity ends with the production of heat from stalk combustion. The dataset includes the emissions to air and the disposal of ashes. The dataset doesn't include heat losses of heat distribution in a local district heating network.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply
tags: Sector: Waste Treatment & Recycling; Agriculture & Animal Husbandry

processDocumentation.timeDescription: based on temporal validity of dataset logs, hardwood, from forest burned in wood heater 6kW
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The original dataset for logs, hardwood, from forest, burned in wood heater 6kW is made for Swiss conditions and assumed to be valid for  stalk in a global geography
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Stalk is known to have similar composition to hardwood. The 6kW wood heater serves as a proxy for the combustion of stalk for cooking and heating purposes. Technical details of the 6 kW wood combustion plant:
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The infrastructure and emission factors are extrapolated from a wood heater of 6kW. The data is originally based on swiss conditions and is assumed valid for global conditions and similarly dimensioned wood combustion plants with a nominal capacity up to 20 kW.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data is adapted from a wood heater of 6kw capacity.

exchanges.description: based on stalk input (in kg), lower calorific value (13.8MJ/kg fresh mass) and calorific efficiency of heater (75%)

flow.name: heat, central or small-scale, other than natural gas
flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
based on utilisation rate of infrastructure (75%) and its  lifetime capacity, calculated with the annual energy produced in the furnace (28800MJ/y) multiplied by its lifetime (20y).

The infrastructure needed is then calculated as:
required infrastructure (unit/reference unit)=1/(utilisation rate * lifetime capacity)

flow.category: C:Manufacturing/28:Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c./281:Manufacture of general-purpose machinery/2815:Manufacture of ovens, furnaces and furnace burners

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
Based on carbon content of stalk and deducted from carbon emissions that leave the system as CO.

The mass of CO2 is calculated with the molecular weigh of C (12g/mol) and CO2.

The carbon is emitted in the exhaust during wood combustion. A complete combustion is assumed, thus no carbon remains in the ash.

flow.name: Fluorine
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
Estimation. Based on emission factor of C that is emitted as CO in hardwood combustion.


The emission factor of C as CO in logs, hardwood  is 2.35E+4 mgC/Kg dry mass. This has been calculated with the lower calorific value of wood (11666MJ/m3 = 17.95MJ/kg dry mass), the dry mass content (650 kg DM/m3) and considering the output of CO (0.003059 kg) in the production of 1 MJ heat with logs, hardwood.

0.003059 kg CO*(1 mol CO/(12+16) kg)* (12 kg/1 mol C) = 0.013 kg C
1MJ heat produced * (1 kg dry mass/17.95 MJ)=0.05 kg dry mass wood
1311 mg C/0.05 kg dry mass = 2.35E+4 mg C / kg DM

flow.name: Carbon monoxide, non-fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
Estimation. Based on ash produced in logs combustion. An average of 1% of the dry mass of wood accrue as ash (personal communication, Keel A., Holzenergie Schweiz, Juni 2002). The same is estimated for stalk.
EcoSpold01Location=CH
